p: Concurrent Plasmodium and CHIKV co-infection inhibited migration of donor CD4 + T cells towards the joints of co-infected recipients by ~6-fold (Fig. 7b). Furthermore, the increase of joint swelling induced by donor’s CD4 + T cells in single CHIKV-infected recipients were absence in co-infected recipients (Fig. 7c). Immune mediators quantified from joint-footpad lysates at 6 dpi demonstrated a reduction of CCR5 ligands (MIP-1α, MIP-1β, RANTES) and CXCR3 ligand (CXCL10) in the joints (Fig. 7d).
